IT is an opportunity to take up various issues with them

When Ministers and senior bureaucrats visit the city, it is common for industry representatives to meet them and present memorandum on the requirements.

This is apart from the meetings they have when they visit the State or national capital.

With just a few more months for the Assembly elections, this is an opportunity for the industries to make their demands to the visiting ministers and political party heads and take forward their requirements.

While majority of the industry associations have a group of people fixing appointments with the VIPs who come to the city, some prefer to have joint industry meetings.

These are to take up not only the issues related to the needs of the industry but also the infrastructure demands of the city and the region.

Trade and industry body heads say some Ministers note down the demands in detail and promise to get back to the industrial associations after interactions with officials in the respective departments.

Some others just take the memorandum with an assurance that they will revert.

Secretary of a textile association says that there is a drastic and “magical” difference in the industry representatives meeting ministers or officials in Chennai or New Delhi to meeting them here.

They get to know more about the industry and requirements here because they are in our city and see for themselves.

Also, more industry people are able to talk to them and their full attention is only on our needs, he says.

Some of the industry association heads met Prime Minister Modi in Coimbatore on Tuesday and submitted their requirements.

M. Soundariya Preetha
title: When Ministers came calling
